did.head: Summary Information
did.abstract: The Ferrell mss, ca. 1940-1999, consist of the papers, writings and correspondence of Indiana University Prof. Emeritus Robert H. Ferrell.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Robert H. Ferrell (b. 1921) is an American historian and author of several books on Harry S. Truman and the diplomatic history of the United States. He received a B.S. in Education from Bowling Green State University in 1946 and a Ph.D. from Yale in 1951. He served in the U.S. Army Air Forces during World War II and as an intelligence analyst in the U.S. Air Force during the Korean War. Ferrell began his career at Indiana University as an Assistant Professor in 1953, subsequently rising to the post of Distinguished Professor of History in 1974.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into correspondence and writings. Correspondence arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence, original drafts of Ferrell’s work, and accompanying research files.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Ferrell mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

did.unittitle: Coolidge, the man and the pres.
The Strange Deaths of President Harding
America: A history of the people
